{{disambig-more|Pel|[[Pel (disambiguation)]]}}
'''PEL''', or '''PELE''', is a [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme|root]] signifying "edge, bound, fence, limit, border".<ref name=PE17>{{PE|17}}, pp. 65, 92, 171 (roots appearing as "√PEL", "PEL", "√PELE)"</ref>

In his Appendix to ''[[The Silmarillion]]'', [[Christopher Tolkien]] noted the Elvish element or root ''pel-'' (signifying "go round, encircle").<ref>{{S|Appendix}}</ref> It is unknown if he reconstructed this element from writings by [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] which have appeared in print after [[1977]] (when the work was first published), or if he used manuscripts which still are unpublished.

==Derivatives==

*PEL
**[[Quenya]]: ''peltakse-'' ("a fence of fixed stakes etc., or a 'pale' and fencing stakes"); ''pelma'' ("a border, fringe, edge, limiting device")<ref name=PE17/><ref group=note>While appearing without any designated language, [[David Giraudeau]] has noted that ''peltakse-'' and ''pelma'' are likely Quenya forms (private correspondence with [[User:Morgan]], as of 13 July 2011).</ref>

*PELE
**[[Quenya]]: ''pelo'' ("a boundary (fence)"); ''[[pella]]'' ("beyond"); cf. ''[[Pelóri#Etymology|Pelóri]]''<ref name=PE17/>

==Other versions==

In the ''Qenya Lexicon'' appears the root PELE, signifying "fence in".<ref>{{PE|12}}</ref>

In the [[The Etymologies|''Etymologies'']] appears the roots PEL ("revolve on fixed point") and PEL(ES) (no signification given).<ref group=note>In the ''Addenda and Corrigenda'' is noted that Tolkien had added "cf. PEL-" to the entry on PEL(ES).</ref> Among the derivatives are:<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 380 (roots appearing as "PEL-", "PEL(ES)-")</ref><ref>{{VT|46a}}, p. 8</ref>

*PEL
**[[Quenya]]: ''[[pel-]]''; ''peltas'' ("pivot")
**[[Noldorin]]: ''pelthaes'' ("pivot")

*PEL(ES)
**[[Kornoldorin|Old Noldorin]]: ''pele'' ("fenced field")
***Noldorin: ''[[pêl]]''
**Quenya: ''peler'', ''opele'' ("walled house or village, 'town')
**Noldorin: ''[[gobel]]''
